snippet: George Osborne, the chancellor of the Exchequer, said in Parliament on Wednesday that it would take four years instead of three for Britain to start reducing its debt as a share of national income.
abstract: George Osborne, chancellor of the Exchequer, tells British Parliament it will take four years instead of three for Britain to start reducing its debt as a share of national income.

byline.original: By JULIA WERDIGIER and STEPHEN CASTLE

lead_paragraph: George Osborne, the chancellor of the Exchequer, said in Parliament on Wednesday that it would take four years instead of three for Britain to start reducing its debt as a share of national income.

headline.main: Britons Are Warned of Lingering Austerity
headline.print_headline: Britons Are Warned Of Lingering Austerity
